website_summaries.verdict: The majority of the wearers agreed that the Saucony Guide ISO was supportive and comfortable. They were impressed with the product's perfect fit and lightweight structure. Although several of them experienced foot numbness, discomfort and blister problems, others still recommended the shoe because of its appearance, responsiveness and affordable price.
pros: A lot of runners commented that the shoe was supportive
According to some reviewers, the product was comfortable
Many testers agreed that the fit was perfect
Several wearers were impressed with the Saucony Guide ISO's lightweight structure
A good number of consumers said that the price was affordable
The majority of the users were happy with the shoe's responsiveness
One of the buyers loved its appearance
cons: Some runners observed that the sole unit was not durable
It irked a few people that it has limited color variations
Some of the testers felt a little pain near the top of the foot while wearing the product
A lot of runners experienced foot numbness
Several users had blister problems after wearing the Saucony Guide ISO

customer_reviews.title: Really cheap materials
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised how shoddily these shoes seem to be made, appear to be really cheap materials. They look like they were put together with stickers and a laser printer. Unlike my previous Saucony Guides, the exteriors aren't even stitched, they're all apparently plastic and adhesives. Was a longtime Brooks runner, then switched to Saucony because I liked their combination of light weight / support. Will try something else now.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas George

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I've been a Saucony Guide fan (series 5-9) for years now. My last purchase was the ISO series, they do not have the same quality as the previous Guide shoes. The construction is tremendously cheaper, although still comfortable. About the same time I purchased the IOS's, I also bought the Mizuno Wave Inspire 13's. The Mizuno's have a slightly harder sole, but they are an extremely well built and comfortable shoe, plus the slightly wider toe box is an advantage.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Favorite running shoe.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Guides. I’ve tried other running shoes, but nothing gives me the fit and support these do. Picked them up on Amazon for a great price and they were able to ship them easily to an APO (something my local store could not). If you’re looking for a shoe with good support and a little offset, this could be the shoe for you.
customer_reviews.author: bag08c

customer_reviews.title: Super value.
customer_reviews.text: I have run marathons in 49 states. This shoe provides great cushioning. I have worn several over the last few years and they hold up. The shoe is better than many more expensive brands.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher N Lee

customer_reviews.title: ... know everyone's feet are different but I have had great luck with Saucony running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I know everyone's feet are different but I have had great luck with Saucony running shoes. I bought the 13W and they are very comfortable. I'm not a runner but I wear these to work and the comfort lasts all day. They also help slightly to turn my out, so I don't walk as flat footed as usual.
customer_reviews.author: Dmo5723

customer_reviews.title: Losing my arch
customer_reviews.text: For years I tried to make shoes feel good. Some the arch did not feel in the right place and in others just plane too high causing pain after 30 minutes in them. Then a local running store recommended going up a half size to move arch towards my toes (duh that makes sense even if shoes are a bit bigger than I need for length. But the best recommendation was the Saucony guide 10. I have never owned Saucony shoes but the Guide 10s were great so at the end of shoe life I ordered the ISO and once again delighted.
customer_reviews.author: DaG

customer_reviews.title: My 2nd pair and I'm pleased again
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first pair of the Guide ISO's about 2 years ago. At the time they were the best fitting running shoe I'd ever owned. After hundreds of miles of running the cushion finally broke down and it was time for a new pair. The new shoes fit perfectly. I'd read some complaints about the construction of these shoes but my first pair held up quite well. Aside from the cushion support breaking down (which is expected) I also wore out the inside of the heal area, but I think that has more to do with me not untying my shoes before slipping them off. A+
customer_reviews.author: Diana P McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes except too hot
customer_reviews.text: I've suffered from plantar fasciitis in the past and have found Saucony shoes to offer the support and stability I need. These continue in that line except the upper does not breathe well and my feet get too hot. After an hour or two, I can't wait to take them off and let my feet cool down. I'm about to buy another style of Saucony running shoes now, spending a bit more probably, to get the complete solution.
customer_reviews.author: PGHRW

customer_reviews.title: Shoes Have Not Held Up
customer_reviews.text: We ordered these shoes in August and less than three months later, they look like they're over a year old. The fabric on the side tore; they are dirty and dingy looking; and far below quality/price. This is my son's seventh pair of Saucony shoes, and up until now we were satisfied. They seem like seconds. So very disappointed in this pair of shoes!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fitting shoe and outstanding value.
customer_reviews.text: I love the comfort and feel of this shoe. I needed the Wide fit to accommodate my orthotic inserts. The shoes are lightweight and Amazon offered such a great deal on the price, I ordered 3 pair. The shoes were shipped for free and arrived within 4 days. I received them, inserted my orthotics and began my daily run. They fit like a glove and were priced way below the price at local stores. Thank you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Long

customer_reviews.title: Saucony  Guide not the same quality anymore.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been buying the Guide series of shoes for about 10 years. Unfortunately the manufacture has started using a softer compound rubber and they do not last. I doubt the manufacture even read these reviews but if they do you need to change the compound or you’re going to lose customers.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great for working out!
customer_reviews.text: This was the first pair of workout shoes I have purchased a second time. The first pair I purchased a couple years ago and are still in great shape. They will now become my outdoor pair while the new ones never see the outside of a gym.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these shoes to run outdoors on pavement. I run about 7-10 miles per week and these shoes feel great. My feet overpronate and roll inwards due to my flat feet and the sole of these shoes corrects that and minimizes the pain I get when running.
customer_reviews.author: DeerHunter217

customer_reviews.title: Shoe is great for Pronators!  Worried about wear
customer_reviews.text: I do not run long distances. I wear these indoors to work and walk a little. I've noticed a lot of wear on the outside treads. My Brooks Beast lasts one year, these may last only a few months...
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I overpronate these will be second my GUIDE ISO
customer_reviews.text: I bought my last pair about 8 months ago and I run around 20 miles a week. They still seem ok, the soul is not worn. I damaged the fabric lining inside the back hill from pulling them off lazilly. I thought they would not last this long. They seem pretty light for a stability type shoe. I do mostly pavement running.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Brantley

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: Good shoes for running. I find them very comfortable and seem to have decent arch support. My only complaint is that they're a bit narrow, if you plan on adding insoles into these shoes then you should order at least a half size larger than what you usually wear. Still is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad shoe
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my feet quite a bit every day. After a couple months on these shoes I'm satisfied. My gripe is that they are made of cheap materials and not actually all that great for athletic things. They are inexpensive so I got about what I expected. Maybe I'll get them again, since I know they fit correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Yummyjackalmeat

customer_reviews.title: Great road shoe
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cushion and stability. Ran in them right out of the box and they were great. Can't really tell the difference between these and the Ride 10s but doesn't matter, they're both excellent hard pavement shoes. I even bought a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Chip K

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Sz12 fits fine, I have wide flat feet. The cushion is good but not too much. Obviously not as wide in to toe box as a Topo but these were on sale. Good for short runs and walks around town.
customer_reviews.author: Liam O'Corcoran

customer_reviews.title: Defective left shoe
customer_reviews.text: Left shoe had bumps in it that only got worse as i broke them in. Returning for refund. Saucony wants photos of the defect. Sort of hard to photograph the inside of the shoe down in the toe box.
customer_reviews.author: george baker

customer_reviews.title: Holes in the fabric almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to test out the Saucony brand and the durability of the shoe is terrible. I had a hole in the back of the heal within a month of running in them. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but lack breathability
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after Saucony discontinues the Ignition series which I loved. They are very comfortable on my feet. However, when I use them for relatively long runs, 8-12 KMs, my feet feel extremely overheated. There's a severe breathability issue with these shoes. I had to stop running a couple of times, and ordered a different pair. I would rate them lower, but since they are indeed very comfortable I gave them 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Rami Kushnir

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe about 2 years ago from a Running Shoe Company. Really liked it and was checking on Amazon and found it, so got this one as spare.
customer_reviews.author: Laxmi Narayana Byagari

customer_reviews.title: B
customer_reviews.text: Fits fine. They are a little bit more cushioned than I would have liked. But they work the way they are supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Decent Sneaker
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair and don't like as much as the 1st pair for some reason, as manufacturing may be a little different. Bought it on sale and using as another pair to wear to the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Shoe w/Great Support
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is very comfortable for running. The toe box is wide enough that your toes don't feel scrunched. Cushioning is very good providing a soft feel on the road. The support is also very good and helps with overpronating feet like mine. Much lower in price though Amazon than at a running store. If you overpronate this shoe might be exactly what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Rick C.

customer_reviews.title: Saucony ISO Guide
customer_reviews.text: Bought the ISO Guide for casual wear. Great for walking, as they are very comfortable. I would prefer a wide, but these does the job. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Titegroup

customer_reviews.title: Good replament for nike
customer_reviews.text: Feels wonderful fit as expected. feels great since day one
customer_reviews.author: PAUL C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice but mine had a Defect
customer_reviews.text: Nice Shoe but mine had a defect in the sole. There was a lump so I returned the shoes. Nice color, though.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kettler

customer_reviews.title: Good value quality sneakers
customer_reviews.text: Really nice sneakers. I use them for walking. Very comfortable. They look very smart, high quality and materials.
customer_reviews.author: John, Dunedin, Fla

customer_reviews.title: Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Fit well. Sole is a soft compound and not designed for high mileage training.
customer_reviews.author: ARDU

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but question quality.
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe. Very comfortable. But the blue is peeling off in several places at the front of the toe. Now there are several noticeable white spots all over the front of both shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Better than my last pair
customer_reviews.text: Great! Feels like I am running on a cloud! I am a bigger runner and these definitely help with any knee pain I’ve had with previous shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great Half Marathon Running Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: New shoes to kick off training for a half marathon. I was pleased with this brand and model for last years race so I repurchased the same kind! Cool sleek silver color. I am pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Hectic Four

customer_reviews.title: Seems good so far.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in good shape. And this time I can not speak to the function. I am a severe over pronator, so we will see. With that?
customer_reviews.author: doug_belllevue

customer_reviews.title: SUPER COMFORTABLE SHOES.
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking shoes very comfortable fit right saucony the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL C.

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been wearing the guides for years now. He likes this pair and says they fit comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Amaddington

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and durable
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair I bought because the first one lasted so long and felt great on my knees. I discovered I pronated many years ago and a running store recently suggested these after a gait analysis. No pain, used for a year.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Rimer

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing similar for years. Not good stability or cushion
customer_reviews.author: Barry Laskov

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Replaced a pair of Saucony’s that was 7 years old
customer_reviews.author: "locdout"

customer_reviews.title: Great for walking and standing for 10 hours
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite pairs of shoes. Great for standing and walking for a 10 hour shift
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with how the shoe feels.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is very heavy and clunky! I also have apair of the ISO II's which feel like a cloud. Not even close to worth the price I paid for these.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Mack

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have super flat feet so I've loved Saucony for years. This shoe was a little narrower than I like, but not uncomfortably so. I only use them for running and have put about 50 miles on them so far.
customer_reviews.author: RONEILL

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for a fair price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great running shoe for those of you with big feet and a moderate overpronation.
customer_reviews.author: Cpt. Rocketpack

customer_reviews.title: So Great
customer_reviews.text: Love Saucony! Fit and feel great. These are for pronaters. Get fitted and get the right shoes for you
customer_reviews.author: Luke Hyatt

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: They r just as I had hoped for. A nice fit and very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Eastern shore guy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoe but runs a bit narrow.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the shoe for general wear and walking. Shoe fit as expected , just a bit narrower than I would have liked but stretching as they become "broken in". Overall a comfortable shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Staffen

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes with lots of support!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the shoe. Item was exactly as described and seller delivered faster than predicted by amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: nice but...
customer_reviews.text: nice shoe but not as nice as the excursion TR, well at least for my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher I. Cobitz

customer_reviews.title: I love this shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I have bunions, I over pronate, and need a firm arch. I love this shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Hudson

customer_reviews.title: breaking down in first few wears
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fits ok, a little narrow and small, but the reviews made me aware of that. The issue is that the liner in the heel bunched up after putting the shoes on a few times, and now lumps out into my upper heel. Feels like putting on old broken down shoes already..
customer_reviews.author: Drew Blake

customer_reviews.title: As expected---which is to say, great.
customer_reviews.text: Sizing is perfect, very comfortable, excellent support. Saucony remains my go-to brand.
customer_reviews.author: patrick

customer_reviews.title: Well fit wide
customer_reviews.text: Very well fit. I ordered wide and it is perfect for me. Cushion is adequate. I would order another for regular walking shoes as well.
customer_reviews.author: Inchan Hwang

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: Just as pictured- nice new line. Husband is very happy.
customer_reviews.author: E. Levy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent comfortable sneakers
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair of Saucony sneakers, and they totally lived up to my expectations. Ever since I had a foot fracture a few years ago, I've bought sneakers that offer more support. The Saucony Iso is a good balance of support and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Br.

customer_reviews.title: Saucing makes great shoes BUT.....
customer_reviews.text: I Love Saucony BUT something was weird about this shoes’ feel during running. Like there was a knot in the sole under the ball of the foot. It’s already in the “donate to charity pile.”
customer_reviews.author: Donald Rioux

customer_reviews.title: These shoes did their job!
customer_reviews.text: The first pair lasted through training before USAF BMT, throughout USAF BMT and particularly thought Tech School PT. The original pair got tested and approved. The only thing that was ungraded was the insoles.
customer_reviews.author: Intense_Canines

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, feel, price
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, great price, great results. My son finished his first 1/2 marathon in these new shoes and said they felt great!
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Let the buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: No support it's ok I guess,if you like loose shoes.
customer_reviews.author: ache feet

customer_reviews.title: Poor durability off the road.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes don't last. This is my 3rd pair and they all rip in the same spot.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Clark

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: I have walked a lot recently and tried these out. They didn't seem to fit my feet quite right and wore out very quickly. They got dirty very easily. I wouldn't buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Good everyday shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Decent cushioning and good stability. Just a little snug in the forefoot.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Scardina

customer_reviews.title: perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit perfect and are very comfortable. The price was great at around $80.00. Can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Long distance must have
customer_reviews.text: I would not use any other shoe. Great for over pronates. Lasts long.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Saucony is stable
customer_reviews.text: Shoes actually protect my feet and feel great running on concrete, gravel, asphalt and treadmills.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sneakers
customer_reviews.text: I bought one pair and fell in love with them. Loved them so much when I needed a new pair I bought 4 more pairs so I’m case they changed I had more
customer_reviews.author: MARY

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and nice to run in; would definitely order this shoe again
customer_reviews.author: roenfri

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for neutral/overpronators
customer_reviews.text: I only buy Saucony for their great shoes. Adequate support and great style.
customer_reviews.author: Faizan

customer_reviews.title: After 510 miles it start to rupture from the sides but doesn’t affect the integrity of the shoe
customer_reviews.text: I had this shoe before and it’s a great shoe for running and the Cushing last a great amount of miles, if you are a serious runner or want a shoe that will satisfy your needs this is the way to go
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lazo

customer_reviews.title: My go to shoe
customer_reviews.text: Have been my go to shoe for years. Still happy with newer versions.
customer_reviews.author: chip p.

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great multipurpose running shoes. Best sauconys I've ever had and I've had about 10 pair.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Morris

customer_reviews.title: True to size!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the size that i would normally wear and they fit perfectly. Time to put some miles on them.
customer_reviews.author: Grgre nowtin

customer_reviews.title: Well worth spending on
customer_reviews.text: Very good shoes I'm on my feet all day at work when I wore them 1st day I said these are good shoes I buy them again thumbs up
customer_reviews.author: Pea

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Saucony did good with the ISO. Solid stability RUNNING shoe.
customer_reviews.author: abcdefgh

customer_reviews.title: Research best type of running shoe for your individual foot.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ran in Saucony since the 90’s. Great fit and smooth on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tread does not last
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, comfortable with good support. However after 3 months the tread is completely gone.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea A. Dye

customer_reviews.title: Good update to Guide 10
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace my worn out Guide 10's. Fit, feel and run seem the same (but new).
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: product description is not adequate
customer_reviews.text: Did not like the feel - no cushioning. This was not made clear and is very unlike other Saucony ISO guide shoes I have worn.
customer_reviews.author: Al Krema

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Guides have been my go to shoe for the past 5 years
customer_reviews.text: I love them for both running 3 miles and as daily walking shoes
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Davis

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfortable fit. Great running shoe.
customer_reviews.text: If you have moderate pronation this is the shoe to go with. I don’t run in any other pair.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Underrated
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for a fraction of the price of the newer model.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these tennis shoes for running and work out.
customer_reviews.author: GONZALO C SAHONERO

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: not enough cushion in the forefoot, and the inside back of the shoe is to weak.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon C

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best shoe ever! Perfect for narrow feet, but also perfect if you have a special insole!
customer_reviews.author: arthur.oliva

customer_reviews.title: Perfect running shoe (for my foot at least!)
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are perfect! Great fit and so comfortable! Can’t wait to get some miles into them
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Caudill

customer_reviews.title: glad the Guide is now with ISO
customer_reviews.text: Needed to move back to a more stable shoe, glad the Guide is now with ISO. Works great...
customer_reviews.author: AAAck

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, very comfortabel to run in.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very comfortable and light feeling I've run on them a few times and they may fit a bit snug up front, but I have high arches, narrow feet so it doesn't bother me. I also wear an insert from my doctor that is probably thicker than an over the counter one, but still feel great. They are airy, light and stable. We'll see how they hold up. I'm 205 and run 3-5 miles daily. In the Army, so they get abused.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Uhl

customer_reviews.title: Great support shoe
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what's up with all of the claims of these ISO versions being different then previous Guides. I've been using Guides for years, and they've all fit and felt the same. If you took the colors and labels off, I wouldn't even be able to tell the difference. I even still have my previous Guide 10's, and swapped back and forth between the two for a few runs, as I gradually broke these in. Anyway, if you liked previous Guides, and/or are looking for a good support shoe, give these a try.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Good

product_meta.title: Saucony Guide Iso, Men's Gymnastics Shoes
